revised_title: A Detailed Study of Weather, Earthquakes, and Epidemics in Maryland (1754-1757)
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of the weather, earthquakes, and epidemics in Maryland from September 1754 to September 1757. The author, Richard Brooke, records the highest and lowest temperatures each month, as well as other observations, including a significant earthquake and a series of damaging storms. He also discusses an epidemic spotted fever affecting humans and an illness killing many dogs, as well as the treatment methods used for these diseases.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Weather
